website_summaries.verdict: The Beyerdynamic DT 770 Studio offers excellent sound quality and a comfortable fit, which helps elevate it from other pro-level headphones.
pros: The Beyerdynamic DT 770 Studio is a well-built monitor headphone which sounds more open and dynamic than its closed-back construction might suggest
The headphones offer a level of comfort not offered by other professional headphones
cons: The DT 770 Studio suffers from limited distribution and is easily confused with other similarly-named, but very different sounding, DT 770 models
The non-removable three-meter cable means the headphone is poorly suited to mobile use

customer_reviews.title: Very rich and punchy sounding closed back headphones.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones really do shine. I compared them to Sennheiser 600, 598cs, and Shure 1540. The Sennheiser 600 has better sound but I wanted to completely eliminate ambient noise bleed, and they are open back [which is why they sound slightly better]. If I lived alone and had a quiet space I would choose the Senn600. The Shure 1540 was close but had a sharper sound where the Beyer was richer and punchier. I ran the sound thru a Fiio Mark 2 amp. 770s are comfy to wear for extended periods as well.
customer_reviews.author: PinkTwig

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have the top of the line version of these, the 990 I believe. I got these for traveling & they sound great, if you want more bass and power I would recommend a headphone amplifier. You can find them anywhere on Amazon. I produce music and DJ, but use these to produce music & I'm happy with them. But if you're playing them loud, people can hear your music around you, just a note. The comfort is really good as well.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: So Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are extremely comfortable. I use them for voice over work including audiobooks. I spend hours in headphones. These headphones let no noise in so they're perfect for audio editing work.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Keppeler

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Highs. Underwhelming lows.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this brand but this model had unbelievably annoying highs compared to the 80 ohm model. In my opinion the 80ohm and 32 ohm model sound nothing like each other and I feel that those looking for mobile listening with the 3ft cable on the 32 ohm model are missing out on what could be amazing headphones. The lows aren’t as prominent as the 80ohm model either which takes a lot of the excitement out of these headphones for me. The 80 ohms would be the perfect headset of that darn 10ft cable was detachable.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Being new to audiophile and to headphones in general, I was blown away by the quality of the build and the high quality sound. Mated with a decent DAC and Hi Fidelity streaming service and I hate taking these things off. I even tried it for gaming and just insane. First was nice and secure and yet still highly comfortable. Will be buying more Beyerdynamics headphones in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund Dobry

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these after listening to my son's DT-770 80 Ohm headset. I ordered the 32 Ohm as most of my listening is on my i-phone or i-pad. Works (sounds) GREAT! As I am not a gamer I didn't rate for gaming. My use on these are YouTube music and Netflix. Headset is well padded and comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.author: TheMask

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for mixing and mastering
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and narrowed it down to 4 headphones that I tried out with over 20 different songs for testing out studio cans. These were the best for the studio. And comfortable. The next closest and the ones I would have gone for (because of the price) were the $70 Beyer DT 240s...except the phone cord of that model made a rustling sound when moving my head just little - something I only noticed with the headphones on and no sound playing. BTW - Spotify has a dedicated playlist for putting cans through the test playlist "the ultimate headphone test"
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: My personal favorite!!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome sound!! I was very surprised at the detail all around. Very clean sound through the whole spectrum. Even sub bass. Well worth the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Big36Kid

customer_reviews.title: High quality, comfortable, worth it
customer_reviews.text: I use these for recording and editing/mastering music..and I love them! (Though I finish my mastering through external, powered monitors) I run them with my focusrite 2i2 and I get plenty of volume with no additional headphone amp needed. The clarity is phenomenal and bass comes though clean. They are super comfortable and I can wear for hours at a time with no fatigue. Definitely worth it for the price! If you're on the edge, get them. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: xjaminx

customer_reviews.title: Winners in my book.
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars because of the sound for the price. Good base balanced with the mids and highs not too much but definitely enjoyable for a variety of music. I broke these in before I listened to them, but afterward in 5 minutes I knew they were keepers. Very comfortable, but I hate the fact that the cord is hardwired in, that dropped the review to 4 stars. Great gamers and very detailed music listening, not tiring at all. This is a fine set of headphones. I bought the 32 ohm model and no amp is needed for a great sound.
customer_reviews.author: BLS

customer_reviews.title: Extraordinary clarity for mobile devices.
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought the headphones for air travel, however, since they come supplied with two sizes of phone jacks, I tried plugging them into my concert digital piano. Wow! The sound is amazing and I can work without bothering everyone else in the house. They are also perfect for recorded music with embedded sound frequency patterns, i.e., delta, theta, beta waves. Perfect for my hospice patients and anyone who has trouble sleeping or focusing. The 32 ohm is exactly right for mobile devices. The clarity and range of sound is beyond anything I’ve had before—even when I spent twice as much.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gill

customer_reviews.title: Need closed-back? Get these! If open-back will work for you, check out DT-990!
customer_reviews.text: If your equipment can drive these, nothing sounds better! Okay, that's not entirely true; if you don't need the noise-reduction provided by closed-back phones, the DT-990's will sound marginally better than these for about the same price, but the audio from these is nothing short of phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Bronstrup Creative

customer_reviews.title: Pro Cans
customer_reviews.text: These are the best cans (headphones) I've had in ages, maybe ever. Comfortable, solid, incredibly clear and tasteful. I am using a 4 channel headphone amp with them even though my Apollo interface is plenty loud enough to run them, I wanted the option to split the signal.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Burroughs

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: These sound amazing, with an insane soundstage for a closed back. I honestly am preferring them to my HE-500 sometimes, which is truly bizarre. Maybe they just scale better than expected, because I'm kind of blown away.
customer_reviews.author: Maul

customer_reviews.title: Truly incredible, I will never hear music the same way.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t say I’m an audiophile, but I appreciate hearing every piece of a song the way the artists hear it in the studio. These will open up a new spectrum of depth in all music you listen to. The 80 ohm are best paired with an amp, I use the Fiio A3 which is amazing and very portable only problem I have ran into is the length of the input cable.
customer_reviews.author: allan wisz

customer_reviews.title: Great cans.
customer_reviews.text: Great cans ...a tad tight out of the box, but they do ease up over time. Pretty neutral sound, a bit heavy on the bass but not overwhelming. I’m very picky regarding sound and these are excellent sounding phones. Use in my recording studio for tracking and mixing. Comparing the sound against my monitors they sound very similar where most cans fall short. Treat them with care and they should last well. Do wish the cord was longer but I guess that’s what extension cords are for.
customer_reviews.author: RsRsRs

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound and comfort
customer_reviews.text: These are incredible headphones. The audio is crystal clear. You’ll hear parts of the music that you’ve never heard before if you haven’t had a comparable pair. They’re also wonderfully comfortable- I’ll sometimes forget that I’m wearing them as I listen to music, and sometimes I feel better wearing them than not. While these aren’t noise cancelling, they do block out most ambient noise.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Logan

customer_reviews.title: Worth More Than The Price Asked.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones. I have the DT 1990 and these are worth it, given the price. They are great for gaming or just listening to music. I have combined with an sound-blaster amp - X7. Sounds amazing. I'm in love with these because the noisy days with my kids watching tv, I can throw these on and become immersed in another world. Thanks Beyer for showing why you're legendary in the first year of using your products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds nice, but doesn't feel comfortable after long use.
customer_reviews.text: Theses headphones have really good quality, music sounds amazing when listening to it. Though when it comes to comfort, these headphones start to hurt my head and I start to get a headache. I have done some research and many people are also saying the same thing. So I wouldn't recommend wearing for long periods of time. After an hour you'll start to feel it. You can prevent the headphones from hurting your head, but that requires you to bend the metal, which you have to be careful about.
customer_reviews.author: may

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones in the world
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones for recommendations in several videos. And at first time I was surprised because the sound was very different to many headphones I've had different brands like Skullcandy, Sony and Fiio. Everything is clearly heard and what gives a plus is that they are really comfortable. It's like having teddy bears in your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Vega

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and great sound.
customer_reviews.text: I have hearing loss so decent headphones are important to me. These are the best I have heard at a reasonable price (am not willing to break the bank as I am only using them for recreational purposes). Also, I have multiple ear piercings and a lot of headphones are not comfortable because of that. These fit nicely around them and don't cause any issues.
customer_reviews.author: ebivi

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I use it to check my recordings. I’m impressed with the noise cancellation. I didn’t hear my phone ring. It’s worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kayfa

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable headphones ever
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. I record on a Shure SM7b and I used to use some audio technicas. So much sound would leak out, but on these you can't hear any sound leaking out at allllll. The bass is amazing as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful set of cans
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones and probably the most comfortable pair I've ever worn. Even after hours of wearing in studio or mixing, my ears are not fatigued even slightly. Decent outside noise reduction from closed back design too.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: Just got the DT770 Pro 80 ohm, I am too lazy to compare the bass, mid, treble and soundstage with other models. Obviously the overall sound quality is much better than that of HD598 or ATH M70x. When I enjoy open-back, it goes to HD600, and when I need closed-back, it's DT770 Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: A really superb headset that cancels outside noises well and delivers clear, pure sound. Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: rehollandsworthmusic

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones. I've used several brands through out the years and it just seems that the DT 770 were the best I've purchased. The bass is always clear without sounding boomy, the high are smooth and present.
customer_reviews.author: P. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I can wear them for hours and they sound incredible. I just use them for music and eventually gaming using a noninvasive mod and I know they'll be perfect. Stop looking around
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to wear. Incredible bass. Convenient storage bag included. Owned previous pair for more than 10 years. Has recently replaced with the new pair and I don’t know what else one could possibly desire. A little drawback though - previous one had longer, thicker, more flexible cable than that one. Does not affect sound and convenience after all, so still 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail

customer_reviews.title: One of the best headphones I have ever owned, worth the price for the 250 ohm version.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best headphones I have ever owned, worth the price for the 250 ohm version. It pays to get a headphone amp and a proper DAC to fully appreciate this headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, build and sound are very good!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wanted to buy this pair of headphones for a long time and they didn’t disappoint! The comfort, build and sound are very good! I would recommend these headphones to anyone. I bought the 32 ohm version and now I want to get a 250 ohm version as well :)
customer_reviews.author: Pavlo Radchenko

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling !!!
customer_reviews.text: Cant hear a thing. Perfect!!!!!!!! Sound quality is a little meh but for its price point its good
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work from the get go
customer_reviews.text: Sent back. probably the reason for the limited edition. Definitely go with the originals!
customer_reviews.author: SCM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my use cases
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my use cases. It's easy to drive. I'm using it on my macbook and iMac. You can buy a app called Boom3D. The sound immediately becomes amazing. Totally worth it
customer_reviews.author: allenlsy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound separation for each instrument. Rich vocal sound with articulation and emotion. Will buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Bing Tong

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, added a separate mix and it's better than most headsets on the market.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Great for mixing and tracking.
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones. I got the 250 and my universal apolo MkII sounds great through them.
customer_reviews.author: Groro2005

customer_reviews.title: Clean sound.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sound earphone you hear every sound, Not for bass. You hear bass but not really strong.
customer_reviews.author: Troy J Foster

customer_reviews.title: I love them and use them for recreational listening at home ...
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable! I love them and use them for recreational listening at home and work
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Olson

customer_reviews.title: Sound is awesome! Very comfortable over long period of studio work
customer_reviews.text: Sound is awesome! Very comfortable over long period of studio work. Headphone amplifier helps give them the kick they need with iPhone or Android device.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: It blocks sound pretty well and goes around
customer_reviews.text: The cable stretches far, but its coiled so it doesn't just clump under my chair. It blocks sound pretty well and goes around, not on, my ears. Sound quality is good. Overall I think its a good set of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Malmrose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: You definitely need a good DAC or power source for these.
customer_reviews.author: David Childs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not much to dislike for this style of headphones. Audio is crisp and I can’t hear much if anything outside the headphones
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie

customer_reviews.title: Grate headphone
customer_reviews.text: Grate sounding headphone well balance for the money I donot think you can do better for the price . Thank you .
customer_reviews.author: Anthony pilato

customer_reviews.title: One of the best buys I've made
customer_reviews.text: One of the best buys I've made! highly recommend! Though it is not rated for the Fiio E10K it still sounds amazing
customer_reviews.author: Evan H.

customer_reviews.title: These are by far the most comfortable yet.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing various types of headphones for work since the 1980's. These are by far the most comfortable yet.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Trygg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is inferior and these are very, very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: comfortable; detailed sound
customer_reviews.text: Solid build; comfortable; detailed sound, but somewhat lean on bass compensated with EQ; great price.
customer_reviews.author: mdale

customer_reviews.title: Saudi arabic
customer_reviews.text: The Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro 250 are the best headphones I've ever owned, they are very comfortable and the sound quality is aweso
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great investment, completely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 250ohm and they sound fantastic. The fit is a little tight but completely tolerable for hours of comfort.
customer_reviews.author: William Hollomon

customer_reviews.title: Great for recording
customer_reviews.text: They're great for recording and reduced noise around when you sing,but not really good for listen music , because the sound so quiet
customer_reviews.author: Rujira

customer_reviews.title: Om
customer_reviews.text: Headphones is fantastic, but if you want to take 250 Om, you need to have good audio card!) Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Kostiantyn

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice clean sound, pretty comfortable for long periods of use and priced reasonably. You're getting what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.author: Abel A.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. They sound great. The build quality is much higher than normal headphones.
customer_reviews.author: KShelton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: perfect for isolation for lossless audio. best quality under $400
customer_reviews.author: Jessie R

product_meta.title: beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro Studio Headphones - Over-Ear, Closed-Back, Professional Design for Recording and Monitoring (80 Ohm, Grey)
product_meta.description: Size:80 OHM| Color:GreyDT 770 STUDIO Headphones. The phrase Studio standard" is thrown around far too often when describing recording gear. That phrase has never been more accurate than when describing the DT-770 by Beyerdynamic. Beyerdynamic invented the dynamic headphone 90 years ago, and the DT-770 has been a studio standard, closed-back headphone for over 30 of those years. The DT-770 is a tracking headphone. It has high isolation to keep what's playing in your headphone in your headphone and out of your microphones. The isolation is also to keep outside sounds out of your monitor mix. The huge bass and crispy highs are there to inspire your performance throughout every session. Since these are professional, handmade in Germany tools, every part including the headband, cable, and earpads can be replaced, ensuring a life-long investment. The only difference between the DT-770 STUDIO and the classic DT-770 is the name. This 80ohm, exclusive headphone is optimized for use in professional recording studios and hi-end recording gear. The word STUDIO has been added to drive the point home that this hi-impedance headphone belongs in the studio.
feature_bullets: Closed over-ear headphones for professional mixing at home or in the studio
Perfect for studio recordings thanks to the their pure and high-resolution sound
Hard-wearing, durable, and robust workmanship Made in Germany

The world famous DT770 Pro Headphones deliver unmatched quality in sound reproduction at an incredible price. No matter your application, tracking, mixing, critical listening, even gaming, your DT770's will deliver sound you can rely on - every time.

Sound - Unique design, construction and innovation give the DT770's superb sound reproduction across all frequencies. Custom built diaphrams in our production facilities in Germany deliver consistent performance to the listener
Quality - DT770's have proven after over 30 years of use in the best studios and sound stages around the world that they perform to the highest level every time.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars178 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
